raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "80", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Systemic vascular resistance (SVR) is calculated as (Mean Arterial Pressure - Right Atrial Pressure) / Cardiac Output. Assuming right atrial pressure is negligible, MAP = SVR x CO. With SVR = 22 mmHg/L/min and CO = 5 L/min, MAP ≈ 22 x 5 = 110 mmHg. MAP also ≈ Diastolic BP + 1/3(Pulse Pressure). With systolic BP = 150 mmHg, Pulse Pressure = 150 - diastolic BP. Setting up the equation: Diastolic BP + 1/3(150 - diastolic BP) = 110. Solving gives diastolic BP ≈ 80 mmHg. Thus, the correct answer is 80.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
